online.search
Class commonRobot<BOARDTYPE extends online.game.BoardProtocol>

java.lang.Object
  online.search.commonRobot<BOARDTYPE>
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.lang.Runnable, online.game.RobotProtocol, online.game.SimpleRobotProtocol
Direct Known Subclasses:
CheckerPlay, GoPlay, HexPlay, TabPlay
public abstract class commonRobot<BOARDTYPE extends online.game.BoardProtocol>
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Runnable, online.game.RobotProtocol

this is the base class for all robots. It contains the connective tissue to connect the robot to the game framework and the search engine, so all your actual robot class needs to do is move and evaluate.

Author:
ddyer

Field Detail

board

public BOARDTYPE extends online.game.BoardProtocol board
our local copy of the game board

GameBoard

public BOARDTYPE extends online.game.BoardProtocol GameBoard
the actual game board

RANDOMIZE

public boolean RANDOMIZE
if true, the first few moves of a game are randomized. If false, the fixed "best move" line is played out. This is actually implemented in your DoFullMove() method

RANDOMSEED

public long RANDOMSEED

DEFAULT_SEARCH_DEPTH

public static int DEFAULT_SEARCH_DEPTH
this is the "default default" value, but normally overridden by the value supplied to Setup_For_Search(int, boolean)

DEFAULT_ALPHA_BETA

public static boolean DEFAULT_ALPHA_BETA
default for using alpha-beta pruning is true. There's no reason to change this except for desperate debugging measures.

DEFAULT_GOOD_ENOUGH

public static boolean DEFAULT_GOOD_ENOUGH
default for cutting off a search when the result is "good enough", where the good enough value is a winning move. The effect of this is to find "a" winning move, not necessarily keep looking for the best winning move.

DEFAULT_PROGRESSIVE_SEARCH

public static boolean DEFAULT_PROGRESSIVE_SEARCH
if true, true a progressive deepening search. This works well for some games. The actual value if this is normally determined by the call to Setup_For_Search(int, boolean)

root

public lib.RootAppletProtocol root
the applet root

robotRunning

public boolean robotRunning
true if the robot is running (ie; searching) "right now"

continuous

public boolean continuous
if true, continue waiting for the next turn, otherwise exit after completing one search. This is normally true, but will be false if using the "test one robot move" menu item.

exitFlag

public boolean exitFlag
this is set to true when the robot is being asked to stop early.

game

public online.game.Game game
this is the game controller from which we started.

viewer

public online.game.ViewerProtocol viewer

rand

public lib.Random rand

public boolean debug

public int verbose

See Also:
Constant Field Values

DEPLOY_THREADS

public static final int DEPLOY_THREADS
the maxumum number of threads to use in a monte carlo seach. Fewer may be used if the environment claims there are fewer available.

See Also:
Constant Field Values

public int Width_Limit_Moves(int depth,
                             int max,
                             online.game.commonMove[] mvec,
                             int sz)
Limit the move vector to a specified size. The vector is full of moves that have been static evaluated and sorted, so removing from teh end is appropriate.

Setup_For_Search

public online.search.Search_Driver Setup_For_Search(int depth,
                                                    boolean pro)
set up for a search, but don't actually start it.

Parameters:
depth - the target search depth
pro - if true, a progressive search with no time limit, if false, a single pass search

Setup_For_Search

public online.search.Search_Driver Setup_For_Search(int depth,
                                                    double progressive_time)
set up for a progressive deepening search, but don't actually start it

Parameters:
depth - is the maximum depth
progressive_time - time limit, in minutes

Setup_For_Search

public online.search.Search_Driver Setup_For_Search(int depth,
                                                    double progressive_time,
                                                    int first_depth)
set up for a progressive deepening search, but don't actually start it.

Parameters:
depth - max depth
progressive_time - a double, time limit in minutes
first_depth - depth of the first search in the progressive search
